# CovidPlot19

<!-- badges: start -->
<!-- badges: end -->

This repo is an R package implemented to get covid19 data from Jhon Hopkins universityâ€™s CSSEGISandData repository and draw some plots about the covid-19 pandemic.

## Installation

You can install the development version from [GitHub](https://github.com/alibalapour/CovidPlot19) with:


``` {r}
options(warn=-1)
# install.packages("devtools")
devtools::install_github("alibalapour/CovidPlot19")
```

## Example

This is a basic example which shows you how to solve a common problem:

```{r example}
df <- suppressWarnings(suppressMessages(CovidPlot19::getData()))
head(df, 20)

```


```{r plotWorldMap}
CovidPlot19::plotOnWorldMap(date = '2020-05-03', type = 'Cases')
```



```{r plotTimeSeries}
CovidPlot19::plotTimeSeries(startDate = '2020-06-10',
               endDate = '2021-07-10',
               country = 'Germany',
               type = 'Cases',
               static = T
               )
```
